intro: Hubera jenkinsii, commonly known as Jenkins' hubera, is a rare and unique plant species native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and early summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Hubera jenkinsii is considered a species of conservation concern.
